intro: Stilpnopappus cearensis, commonly known as the Cearense thistle, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. Its floral structure consists of both ray and disc flowers, which are typical of the daisy family. Stilpnopappus cearensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
